headline.main: Soda Bans in Schools Have Limited Impact

docs.abstract: The study found that removing soda only prompted students to buy sports drinks and other sugar-laden beverages instead.
docs.snippet: The study found that removing soda only prompted students to buy sports drinks and other sugar-laden beverages instead.

headline.main: What The Kids Are Doing These Days

docs.lead_paragraph: Living in a van, or ''vandwelling,'' is now fashionable. The data firm RealtyTrac predicts 1.2 million homes will be repossessed this year, but van sales are up 24 percent, according to the auto-information company Edmunds.com. The singer Sly Stone lived in a van in Los Angeles, though his lawyer reportedly rented him a four-bedroom home. Jessica Spaulding owns two apartment buildings in Arizona but lives in a car. ''People always think that's crazy,'' she says dismissively. Jason Odom, author of ''Vanabode,'' says nonvan homes lead to ''crushed dreams, boredom, obesity, poor health and a house to sleep away the pain in.'' He lives with his wife in a white Chevy van in Florida, where ''it's not muggy this time of year.''

headline.seo: Potential Conflicts on U.S. Health Guideline Panels
headline.main: Health Guideline Panels Struggle with Conflicts of Interest

docs.abstract: Financial conflicts have surfaced among members of three groups that are developing major public health standards on hypertension, cholesterol and obesity; about 20 members have been advised that they should not vote on crucial topics as they prepare to issue guidelines, because they are too closely connected to drug industry and others with keen interest in panels' recommendations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Financial conflicts have surfaced among members of three groups that are developing major public health standards on hypertension, cholesterol and obesity.
docs.snippet: Financial conflicts have surfaced among members of three groups that are developing major public health standards on hypertension, cholesterol and obesity.

headline.print_headline: School Lunch Proposals Set Off a Dispute
headline.main: School Lunch Proposals Set Off a Dispute

docs.abstract: Federal proposal to cut back on potatoes and sodium in the federal school lunch program is being met by fierce resistance from agricultural and food service interests.
